Title: ‘I can’t believe I won a car,’ UNIBEN student reacts to MTN Campus Invasion
Summary: MTN Go MAD Campus Invasion hit the University of Benin (UNIBEN) between September 11 and 13, transforming the school into a hub of entertainment and innovation . For the three days, students explored interactive booths and engaged in workshops .

Title: Okechukwu warns NNPCL, unions against alleged sabotage of Dangote Refinery
Summary: NNPCL, unions against alleged sabotage of Dangote Refinery . Founding member of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has warned against joining in the alleged conspiracy .

Title: Adeleke’s govt outperformed APC’s 12-year record in 32 months – Osun students
Summary: Student leaders from across higher institutions in Osun State have overwhelmingly endorsed Governor Ademola Adeleke for a second term in office . Osun students declare that the governor has surpassed the 12-year governance records of the All Progressives Congress in less than three months .

Title: UNIBEN 200-level student wins car in MTN Campus Invasion
Summary: Edomwonyi Osariemen, a 200-level student of the Faculty of Engineering, won a brand-new 2025 Alsvin Mikano car . He was one of the hundreds of students who participated in the MTN Campus Invasion .

Title: Stakeholders reject telecom academy, urge FG to strengthen DBI
Summary: Stakeholders in Nigeria’s telecom and Information and Communication Technology sector have urged the Federal Government to strengthen the Digital Bridge Institute (DBI) and expand its mandate to bridge skill gaps in the industry .

Title: Gov Abdulrazaq commends Isin vigilante, urges  firm action against criminals
Summary: Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq of Kwara State commends the firm and patriotic resistance of the people of Isin, Kwara . Governor Abdulrazaq urges firm action against criminals .

Title: Rivers holds Thanksgiving Service as emergency rule nears end
Summary: Activities marking the end of emergency rule in Rivers State commenced on Sunday with an inter-denominational thanksgiving service . The service was attended by the state administrator, Vice Admiral Ibok-Ette Ekwe Ibas (rtd), top government officials, traditional rulers, security chiefs, and other dignitaries .

Title: North Korea executing people for sharing foreign films, TV – UN report
Summary: North Korea is increasingly imposing the death penalty, including for watching or sharing foreign films and TV dramas, a new UN report reveals . The country is also forcing citizens into labour, according to the report .

Title: Japan sets record of nearly 100,000 people aged over 100
Summary: Japan sets record of nearly 100,000 people aged over 100 . The number of people aged 100 or older has climbed to a record 99,763 . The health ministry announced the 55th consecutive year of growth .

Title: INEC does not rig elections – Anambra REC
Summary: Resident Electoral Commissioner (REC) for Anambra State, Dr. Queen Elizabeth Agwu, insists that INEC does not have the capacity to rig elections .
